Legal_Issue: Can new or contextual evidence not before the decision-maker be included in affidavits for judicial review?
Evidence_Assessment: New evidence offered as contextual background; assessed for admissibility
Decision_Outcome: Motion to strike out denied; affidavits remain unchanged
Legal_Rule: Judicial review considers errors based on evidence available to the decision-maker; exceptions for special circumstances (abusive, irrelevant, speculative)
Procedural_Issue: Inclusion of new evidence in affidavits for judicial review
Grounds_for_Claim: Respondent claimed improper evidence was included
Outcome_on_Merits: Not decided at this stage; judge will assess admissibility and weight
Key_Evidence_Considered: Affidavits containing new or contextual evidence
Applicant_Challenge: Argued new evidence was contextual background
Court_Result: Motion denied; costs awarded to applicant
Defendant_Response: Respondent sought removal of new evidence from affidavits
Remedy_Requested: Removal of affidavits or parts containing new evidence
Outcome: Motion denied; affidavits stand; costs to applicant
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial determination on admissibility by reviewing judge
Outcome_of_Review: Pending further assessment by judge on admissibility and weight
Governing_Rule: Judicial review limited to record before tribunal, with narrow exceptions
